channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Aerial problems, 8th July
item.description:
There is a problem with the TV aerial meaning residents in the block do not have freeview TV. Please can this be sorted?

item.title: Waste dumped all over Craig’s Court, 8th July
item.description:
Waste dumped in Craig's Court bags and cardboard commercial waste mixed up with residential recycling with general waste some of the bags / buckets dumped have been reported 2 now - nothing's done- why ? why doesnot the council make businesses - mainly pubs - 2/3 owned by youngs brewery - clean up ? why is the council giving this public realm.away for free and they don't even clean it - especially recent 'pubs' such as Walker's of Whitehall !? they block fire exits and ram pavements next to bins and waste urine and worse- yet nothing is done ? please help !

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 7, Whitehall, Waterloo, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Old car causing air and noise pollution by revving the engine, 8th July
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise a concern about a serious case of air and noise pollution caused by a car idling near Westminster School during school dismissal hours. Earlier today, I observed an old car near the school with its engine continuously idling. The driver, a woman wearing a feathered hat, kept aggressively revving the engine even while stationary, producing thick exhaust fumes and excessive noise. She appeared angry, having already shouted at another driver, which made it difficult to approach her directly. The smell of the exhaust was strong and unpleasant, clearly affecting pedestrians nearby. Children walking home from school were visibly uncomfortable, some pinching their noses to avoid breathing in the fumes. A woman with a pram was also seen trying to shield herself and her child from the polluted air as she walked past. This incident occurred in a busy, pedestrian-heavy area close to a school, making it especially concerning due to the presence of young children. The impact was both auditory and environmental, with the engine noise and exhaust fumes contributing to significant public discomfort. This raises questions about whether the vehicle in question has passed a valid MOT test, considering the level of emissions and engine condition. Detailed Summary: An old car was observed excessively idling and revving near Westminster School, releasing heavy exhaust fumes and creating noise pollution during school pick-up hours. This posed a health risk to children and other pedestrians. The driver's aggressive behavior prevented public intervention. I urge the council to investigate whether this vehicle complies with emissions standards and to enforce stricter controls on idling and polluting vehicles near school streets. Please take appropriate action to investigate and prevent such incidents in the future
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): John Islip Street, Millbank, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Complaint Regarding Idling Vehicle Causing Air and noise Pollution Near Westminster School- Possibly MOT expired vehicle on road., 8th July
item.description:
I am writing to formally raise a concern about a serious case of air and noise pollution caused by a car idling near Westminster School during school dismissal hours. Earlier today, I observed an old car near the school with its engine continuously idling. The driver, a woman wearing a feathered hat, kept aggressively revving the engine even while stationary, producing thick exhaust fumes and excessive noise. She appeared angry, having already shouted at another driver, which made it difficult to approach her directly. The smell of the exhaust was strong and unpleasant, clearly affecting pedestrians nearby. Children walking home from school were visibly uncomfortable, some pinching their noses to avoid breathing in the fumes. A woman with a pram was also seen trying to shield herself and her child from the polluted air as she walked past. This incident occurred in a busy, pedestrian-heavy area close to a school, making it especially concerning due to the presence of young children. The impact was both auditory and environmental, with the engine noise and exhaust fumes contributing to significant public discomfort. This raises questions about whether the vehicle in question has passed a valid MOT test, considering the level of emissions and engine condition. Detailed Summary: An old car was observed excessively idling and revving near Westminster School, releasing heavy exhaust fumes and creating noise pollution during school pick-up hours. This posed a health risk to children and other pedestrians. The driver's aggressive behavior prevented public intervention. It is surprising how this vehicle would pass the MOT test. I urge the council to investigate whether this vehicle complies with emissions standards and to enforce stricter controls on idling and polluting vehicles near school streets. Please take appropriate action to investigate and prevent such incidents in the future.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 53, Ponsonby Place, Millbank, London
